revised_title: Histological Features and Physiological Properties of the Post-oesophageal Nerve Cord in Crustacea
tldr: The author examines the nervous system of crustaceans, focusing on the post-oesophageal nerve cord. They describe the structure and function of various ganglia and sense cells in the nervous system, as well as the connections between them. The study provides insights into the primitive features of crustacean nervous systems and their sensory systems.
